trends: There have been no other sightings in Fairview
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: White Oval object spotted in North Central Texas
divs: sighting detailsi was a passenger in my mothers car heading south on country club road (cr 1378 fairview,tx)heading back from a meeting with a fire dept chief. as my mother was talking to me, i to be traveling at around a 20,000 ft altitude. there were no clouds in the air and saw an oval shaped object moving at a high rate of speed heading south. i initially noticed it with a viewing angle of approx 30degrees, 3-5 miles away. i told my mother to look in the sky, and said "omg what is that?" she was talking on the cell phone(driver), and told me to "hush" she did not see anything, nor bother looking because of traffic. my nephew however was in the back seat, and also saw the same object. as we watched it, i was amazed by the speed of this object. it was moving faster than anything i have ever seen in the sky. it kept its course and disappeared suddenly. camera type: fuji finepix s7000 (no pics of ufo just used as a reference angle) visual characteristics: oval white shaped orb, semi-translucent. size: cannot accurately determine, but if you hold a pen vertically, it was about that width looking at it superimposed. temperature: approx 95 degrees humid, no clouds visible in any direction. sun loaction: the object was traveling south and the sun was setting west at a 45 angle. total viewing time 25 seconds there were no obstructions to my viewing, besides a group of trees near the last moments we watched it. credentials: i am active duty military on leave in texas. i work on aircraft, and have been on the flightline for almost 20 years. i am familiar with the flight patterns in my area as well. i am a prior certified aerial observer for helicopters. i have flown many hours as well. i am a veteran of somalia,and the gulf war, and am currently stationed on an active duty marine aviation base in arizona. i did not have time to take a video or a picture because my camera was in the back seat under shopping bags full of clothing. i chose to go outside when we got home, and take pictures of the angle, as well as provide the exact location of the sun, to include the showing of an aircraft flying nearby which lands at dfw about 30 miles west of this location. i have a keen eye, and know aviation assets, as well as satellites, weather balloons and glare\light reflections from planes and the sun. i have never seen anything travel so fast. thank you for your time (gysgt usmc)
